meanings.definition: Run away secretly in order to get married.
meanings.sent1: The young couple eloped to Las Vegas to tie the knot.
meanings.sent2: They eloped to avoid a big wedding and just wanted to be together.
meanings.sent3: The lovebirds eloped, leaving their families surprised but happy.
meanings.sent4: Their hearts eloped long before they made it official.
meanings.sent5: The idea of eloping seemed romantic and adventurous to them.

meanings.definition: Leave home secretly in order to escape marriage or other responsibilities.
meanings.sent1: She eloped in the middle of the night to avoid an arranged marriage.
meanings.sent2: The young man eloped to avoid the pressure of taking over the family business.
meanings.sent3: The cat eloped from the house, tired of being chased by the dog.
meanings.sent4: His mind eloped to a faraway land where he could be free from all obligations.
meanings.sent5: The idea of eloping from his duties seemed more and more tempting.
